newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yamanouchi sees record earnings in 1997/98.
newsitem.headline: Yamanouchi sees record earnings in 1997/98.

text.p: Yamanouchi Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said on Wednesday that its parent current profits are likely to reach a record 66.5 billion yen in 1997/98, up from 65 billion yen forecast for 1996/97.
A company spokesman said the firm's group net profit is likely to reach a record 48 billion yen in 1997/98, up 12 percent from the amount forecast for the year just ended.
The company expects earnings to rise mainly due to robust sales of its ulcer drug Gastar and dysuria drug Harnal, the spokesman said.
The firm forecasts 1997/98 parent sales of 320 billion yen and group sales of 465 billion yen.
